{"step_by_step_thinking": "Occlusal sealants, bonding agents, and composite resins are all dental materials used in restorative dentistry. BIS-GMA, or Bisphenol A-glycidyl methacrylate, is a common monomer found in these materials, providing them with their necessary properties. Polymethyl methacrylate is used in dentures, not in sealants, bonding agents, or composite resins. Benzoin methyl ether is not commonly used in dental materials. Silica filler is used in composite resins, but not in occlusal sealants or bonding agents.", "answer_choice": "A. BIS GMA"}
